data.text: Great travail is created for every man,
The expectation of things to come, and the day of death,
From him that sitteth on a throne of glory,
From him that weareth purple and a crown,
There is  wrath, and jealousy, and trouble, and disquiet,
A little or nothing is his resting,
In the very time of his deliverance he awaketh,
It is thus  with all flesh, from man to beast,
Death, and bloodshed, and strife, and sword,
All these things were created for the wicked,
All things that are of the earth turn to the earth again:
All bribery and injustice shall be blotted out;
The goods of the unjust shall be dried up like a river,
In opening his hands a man  shall be made glad:
The children of the ungodly shall not put forth many branches;
The sedge that groweth  upon every water and bank of a river
Bounty is as a garden Gr. in.  of blessings,
The life of one that laboureth, and is contented, shall be made sweet;
Children and the building of a city establish a man’s  name;
Wine and music rejoice the heart;
The pipe and the psaltery make pleasant melody;
Thine eye shall desire grace and beauty;
A friend and a companion never meet amiss;
Brethren and succour are for a time of affliction;
Gold and silver will make the foot stand sure;
Riches and strength will lift up the heart;
The fear of the Lord is as a garden of blessing,
My son, lead not a beggar’s life;
A man that looketh unto the table of another,
In the mouth of the shameless begging will be sweet;
